inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Wilson disease was confirmed by high liver copper concentration (305 μg/g dry weight of liver)

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient and his parents agreed to participate in the study.

inclusion.criterion: will be sent with Brunel Mood Scale, BORG scale, PEDI and Sociodemographic Information
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient and his parents were sent the questionnaires to fill out.

inclusion.criterion: parents and participants finish those scales
inclusion.label: unknown
met
inclusion.evidence: After finishing the questionnaires, the patient started the protocol practice on the gaming platform.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient started the protocol practice on the gaming platform.

inclusion.criterion: participants will perform the task individually in their own house with a family member helping and giving support during all protocol
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient performed the task individually in his own house with his parents' help.

inclusion.criterion: researcher contacts the family member and gives instructions using videocall
inclusion.label: unknown
met
inclusion.evidence: The patient started the protocol practice on the gaming platform.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient completed the protocol, which consisted of 4 assessments and 3 game phases.

exclusion.criterion: motor difficulties that impede the completing of the virtual tasks
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The patient did not have any motor difficulties that would prevent him from completing the virtual tasks.

exclusion.criterion: do not have technology devices to perform the virtual task (computer) or to contact the researcher (cell phone or a second computer)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: was precluded from completing the task due to some technological failure (such as internet crash)
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The patient did not experience any technical difficulties that would prevent him from completing the task.

notes: A 22-year-old Caucasian man with a history of tremors since a year ago, diagnosed with Wilson disease. He has aggressive behavior and jaundice, hepatosplenomegaly, and hypotonia of the upper limbs.
